Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

1. Lie on your back with bent knees and heels on a slider. | 2. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground). | 3. Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it. | 4. Extend and bend the working leg.
1. Lie on your back keeping both knees bent. | 2. Have a slider under the heel of the working leg. | 3. Extend and bend the working lag applying gentle downwards pressure.
1. Stand up straight using a balancing aid. | 2. Shift your weight on one leg. | 3. Bend and extend the non-weight bearing leg. | 4. Knees should remain aligned.

1. Lie on your back with slightly bent knees and heels on sliders. | 2. Pull your heels towards your glutes to lift your hips off the ground. | 3. Extend knees to starting position, but do not rest hips on ground.
1. Stand up straight using a balancing aid. | 2. Shift your weight on one leg. | 3. Bend the non-weight bearing leg and hold. | 4. Knees should remain aligned.

1. Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees and toes raised. | 2. Place sliders under your heels. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | 3. Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees. | 4. Extend your legs in a slow, controlled manner, to lower your bum to the ground. | 5. Casually bend knees before repeating.

Exercise Name: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Unilateral
Instructions: 1. Lie on your back. Place one heel on a box or bench, having a 90 angle at hip and knee. | 2. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | 3. Push through your heel into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

Exercise Name: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Bilateral
Instructions: 1. Lie on your back. Place your heels on a box or bench, having a 90 angle at hips and knees. | 2. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground). | 3. Push through your heels into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

1. Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and heels dug in. | 2. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground). | 3. Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it. | 4. Hold the position for the specified duration.
1. Hold on to something stable and pull the leg on the opposing side straight up. Hold this position.

1. Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | 2. Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | 3. Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | 4. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

1. Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. | 2. Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | 3. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

1. Lie on your back, heels on a stability ball, arms flat, and core engaged. | 2. Lift hips, curl the ball toward you using your hamstrings, keeping control and balance. | 3. Extend legs back to start while keeping hips lifted, then repeat for desired reps.

1. Lie face down on a stability ball, hands on the floor, legs extended straight. | 2. Engage glutes and lower back, raising legs until aligned with your torso. | 3. Slowly lower legs back down without touching the ground, maintaining core engagement. Repeat.

1. Lie face-down on a stability ball, hips centered, feet anchored, hands behind your head. | 2. Engage your core, lift your upper body until aligned with legs, keeping your neck neutral. | 3. Lower your torso slowly back to the starting position, maintaining control and steady breathing.

1. Place one knee on a bench. | 2. Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | 3. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

1. Go to your knees and ask someone to hold your ankles. | 2. Put your hands in front of you | 3. With a slight bend in your knees slowly bring your body to the ground (slower is better) | 4. Push up and reset to the starting position.
1. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. | 2. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | 3. Lower your body back to starting position.

1. Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. | 2. Pull your body straight up to the bar. | 3. Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

1. Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | 2. With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | 3. Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.
1. Set up rings at a high point. | 2. Grip rings and lean back, arms extended. | 3. Pull chest to rings, keeping body straight.
1. Grasp the chin-up bar with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | 3. Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.
1. Grasp the chin-up bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | 3. Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.
1. Grasp the chin-up bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | 3. Use your legs to assist as you pull your chest to the bar.
1. Grasp the chin-up bar with a mixed grip, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Place your feet on the ground, legs bent slightly. | 3. Use your legs to assist as you pull your chin above the bar.
1. Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with an underhand grip. | 2. Pull your body straight up to the bar. | 3. Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

1. Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. | 2. Pull your body straight up to the bar. | 3. Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

1. Grab a door frame or a rack and place your feet near the frame. | 2. Start with your elbows extended, row your body towards your hands. | 3. Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.

1. Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | 2. With your body in an "L" position and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the bar. | 3. Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

1. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Pull your legs up until you're in an "L" position. | 2. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. | 3. Lower your body back to starting position.

1. Grab the bar shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | 2. With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up and lean backwards. Try to touch your chest to the bar. | 3. Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

1. Grab the rings shoulder width apart with a supinated grip (palms facing you) | 2. With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up until your chin is past the rings. | 3. Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.

1. Grab the rings shoulder width apart with a pronated grip (palms facing away). | 2. With your body hanging and arms fully extended, pull yourself up and rotate your fists until your chin is past the rings. | 3. Slowly return to starting position. Repeat.
1. Grasp the rings with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. | 2. Pull your body up until your chin is above the rings. | 3. Lower your body back to starting position.
1. Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms backwards in small circles.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | 2. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | 3. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

1. Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat

1. Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Start in a plank position. | 2. Raise your arm out in front of you. | 3. Return to the starting position, then raise the opposing arm. | 4. Make sure to keep your hips stable. If you're unable to, try performing this exercise from the knees.
1. Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | 2. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | 3. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

1. Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat
1. Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | 2. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | 3. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

1. Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat

1. Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms backwards in small circles.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.
1. Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment | 2. Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows | 3. Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

1. Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

1. Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. | 2. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width. | 3. Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench. | 4. Push body up until arms are extended.

1. Use a bench to elevate your feet. | 2. Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. | 3. Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground | 4. Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

1. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up, clap hands. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond shape under your chest. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Start by placing two plates or low boxes on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | 2. Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the boxes/plates, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor. | 4. Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells. | 5. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.

1. Start by placing two boxes (or one) on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | 2. Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the box, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Put your knees on the floor. | 4. Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the box. | 5. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.
1. Begin in kneeling position. Hands shoulder width apart. Break at the elbows while letting your elbows fall to the floor. | 2. Extend your elbows until you are back in the starting position.
1. Begin in a plank position. Hands shoulder width apart. Break at the elbows while letting your elbows fall to the floor. | 2. Extend your elbows until you are back in the starting position.

1. Grip the edge of the boxes with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.
1. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Position rings shoulder-width apart, grasp handles, extend legs behind. | 2. Lower chest to rings, bend one elbow, while extending your other arm out to the side. Push yourself back to the start. | 3. Then switch arms and repeat.

1. Attach the ring straps to a high point. Stand on your tip toes. | 2. Your arms should be extended in front of you. | 3. Break at the elbows until your forearms touch your biceps. Then extend your elbows back to the start.

1. Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

1. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

1. Grip the edge of the boxes with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

1. Grip the edge of the bench with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

1. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

1. Grip the edge of the boxes with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.

1. Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet. | 2. Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | 3. Slowly raise your body back to the start position.
1. Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat

1. Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat

1. Start in a plank position and raise your hips toward the ceiling. | 2. Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | 3. Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

1. Use a bench or an object like a chair to elevate your feet. | 2. Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | 3. Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

1. Start in a plank position and raise your hips toward the ceiling. | 2. Slowly lower your body (scapula) while keeping your elbows locked (this is key) | 3. Slowly raise your body back to the start position.

1. Stand with your back to a bench (or raised surface) and place one of your feet on the bench. | 2. Squat down until your front leg is about parallel to the floor. | 3. Go back to the starting position. After completing the desired amount of reps, switch legs and repeat.
1. Take a slow, lateral step to the right. | 2. Extend the left knee, and drive your weight into your right side. | 3. Flex your knee and lower your body. | 4. Push back to the starting position.

1. Step forward with one leg. | 2. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. | 3. Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot. | 4. Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | 3. When you land, lower your body back into the squat position.
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. | 2. flex your knees and hips and sit back into the squat while lowering your body | 3. Continue down to full depth | 4. Return to starting position.

1. Start with a box or bench behind you and one of your feet on the box/bench. | 2. The balls of your feet should be planted on the box/bench. | 3. Drive through the ball of your foot extending your knees until you're upright and standing on the box.

1. Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench). | 2. Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower. | 3. Hold the stick in your right arm and put your right leg on the box. | 4. Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.

1. Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. | 2. Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement with your other leg.

1. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee almost touches the ground. Keep your chest up and your front foot flat on the floor. | 2. Push through your front foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement with your other leg.

1. Place your heels on a plate or very low step. | 2. Keep your chest tall and initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and breaking at the knees. | 3. You should notice yourself able to squat lower than normal.

1. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body. | 2. Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground. | 3. As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight. | 4. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.

1. Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | 2. Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
1. Take a split stance. Make sure to keep your chest tall. | 2. Bring your rear knee to the floor or close to it. | 3. Drive through your front heel and your rear foot back to the starting position.

1. Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you. | 2. Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes. | 3. Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body. | 4. Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. | 5. Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.

1. Stand in front of a box. | 2. *Start with a low box if this is your first time* | 3. Sink into a quarter of half squat and then pop your hips forward. | 4. Try to land in the middle of the box as softly as possible to minimise impact on your joints.

1. Stand on top of a box. Step off of the box and land on the floor. | 2. Land as softly as possible. Squat as you land to minimise impact on your joints. | 3. Go straight into another hop after you've landed. This will help you learn to absorb impact.
1. Setup two boxes. One to jump on and one to sit. | 2. Go from a seated position and pop your hips forward forcefully. | 3. Jump and land on the box softly.
1. Stand with a shoulder width stance. | 2. Jump onto your box and land with one foot. | 3. Try to land in the middle of the box and land as softly as possible.
1. Start in a standing position. | 2. Lunge forward, switch legs mid-air. | 3. Land and repeat.
1. Start with a shoulder width stance. | 2. Jump laterally and fall into a squat. Tap the ground. | 3. Jump the opposite direction
1. Hold a dumbbell in goblet position. | 2. Squat down to parallel depth and then halfway back up. | 3. Stay in this short range of motion for the duration of the set.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width. | 2. Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | 3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width. | 2. Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | 3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Start by doing a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | 3. Narrow your stance while in the air, and land softly. Go directly into another rep.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | 2. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | 3. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Start by doing a regular squat, tap the floor, then engage your core and jump up explosively. | 3. Bring your feet mostly together, tap your toes back to the floor, then bring your feet back their original width.
1. Place the barbell on your back | 2. Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down. | 3. Return to start and repeat on other leg.
1. Stand tall, feet hip-width apart. | 2. Step right, lunge to side. | 3. Return, then lunge left.
1. Stand with feet together. | 2. Step back with right foot. | 3. Return to starting position, then lunge with left foot.

1. Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height. | 2. Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box, bring your off leg all the way through until your leg is parallel with the ground. | 3. Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. | 3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. Then switch legs.

1. Take a step forward shifting your weight onto the front leg. | 2. Bend the knee of the front leg so the knee of the back leg comes close to the ground. | 3. Stand up and go into lunging with the opposite leg.

1. Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up. | 3. Push through your heels to return to the standing position.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, one foot slightly behind. | 2. Lower into a squat, keeping weight on front heel. | 3. Return to standing, engaging glutes and core.
1. Stand on one leg, extend the other forward for balance. | 2. Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up and core tight. | 3. Press through your heel to stand back up, repeat.

1. Press your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Lower into a squat position, thighs parallel to the floor, knees above ankles. | 3. Hold the position, maintaining tension in your core and legs.
1. Stand on a platform, feet hip-width apart. | 2. Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | 3. Push through front foot, return to start.
1. Place your foot on a plate or a low box. | 2. Put all of your weight on your front foot and lean forward. | 3. Lower until your calves touch your hamstrings and then extend back up.

1. Stand on a platform, feet hip-width apart. | 2. Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | 3. Push through front foot, return to start, keeping bar stable throughout.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, stability ball behind your back against a wall. | 2. Lean back onto the ball, bend knees forward, lowering slowly while keeping hips extended. | 3. Push through toes, straighten legs, and return to standing while maintaining balance and control.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, placing a stability ball between your lower back and wall. | 2. Slowly squat down by bending knees to 90 degrees, keeping back straight and core engaged. | 3. Press through heels, straighten legs, and return to standing while maintaining balance and control.

1. Step forward with one leg. | 2. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. | 3. Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot. | 4. Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.

1. Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. | 2. Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement with your other leg.
1. Place the barbell on your back | 2. Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down. | 3. Return to start and repeat on other leg.

1. Step forward with one leg. | 2. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. | 3. Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot. | 4. Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.

1. Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. | 2. Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement with your other leg.

1. Stand in front of a box. | 2. *Start with a low box if this is your first time* | 3. Sink into a quarter of half squat and then pop your hips forward. | 4. Try to land in the middle of the box as softly as possible to minimise impact on your joints.

1. Stand on top of a box. Step off of the box and land on the floor. | 2. Land as softly as possible. Squat as you land to minimise impact on your joints. | 3. Go straight into another hop after you've landed. This will help you learn to absorb impact.
1. Setup two boxes. One to jump on and one to sit. | 2. Go from a seated position and pop your hips forward forcefully. | 3. Jump and land on the box softly.
1. Place the barbell on your back | 2. Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down. | 3. Return to start and repeat on other leg.

1. Step forward with one leg. | 2. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. | 3. Ensure you remain upright, and your front knee stay above the front foot. | 4. Push off the floor with your front foot until you return to the starting position. Switch legs.

1. Step your left foot diagonally behind your right leg, crossing it behind your body. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee is hovering just above the ground. | 2. Push through your right foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. | 3. Repeat the movement with your other leg.

1. Stand in front of a box. | 2. *Start with a low box if this is your first time* | 3. Sink into a quarter of half squat and then pop your hips forward. | 4. Try to land in the middle of the box as softly as possible to minimise impact on your joints.

1. Stand on top of a box. Step off of the box and land on the floor. | 2. Land as softly as possible. Squat as you land to minimise impact on your joints. | 3. Go straight into another hop after you've landed. This will help you learn to absorb impact.
1. Setup two boxes. One to jump on and one to sit. | 2. Go from a seated position and pop your hips forward forcefully. | 3. Jump and land on the box softly.
1. Place the barbell on your back | 2. Step your foot back and around while simultaneously bringing the weight down. | 3. Return to start and repeat on other leg.

1. Start with a box or bench behind you and one of your feet on the box/bench. | 2. The balls of your feet should be planted on the box/bench. | 3. Drive through the ball of your foot extending your knees until you're upright and standing on the box.
1. Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment | 2. Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows | 3. Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. | 2. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width. | 3. Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the bench. | 4. Push body up until arms are extended.

1. Use a bench to elevate your feet. | 2. Put your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. | 3. Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground | 4. Raise your body until you almost lock your elbows.

1. Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you. | 2. Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes. | 3. Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body. | 4. Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead. | 5. Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up, clap hands. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond shape under your chest. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Start by placing two plates or low boxes on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | 2. Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the boxes/plates, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Keep your feet together, with your toes resting on the floor. | 4. Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the dumbbells. | 5. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.

1. Start by placing two boxes (or one) on the floor, about shoulder-width apart. | 2. Position yourself in a plank position with your hands on top of the box, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Put your knees on the floor. | 4. Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms, until your chest nearly touches the box. | 5. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms and engaging your chest, triceps and shoulders.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Grip the edge of the boxes with your hands, Keep your feet together and legs straight. | 2. Lower your body straight down. | 3. Slowly press back up to the starting point. | 4. TIP: Make this harder by raising your feet off the floor and adding weight.
1. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Position rings shoulder-width apart, grasp handles, extend legs behind. | 2. Lower chest to rings, bend one elbow, while extending your other arm out to the side. Push yourself back to the start. | 3. Then switch arms and repeat.

1. Start by adjusting the rings straps to chest height. Stand facing the rings with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Grasp the rings' handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 3. Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head. | 4. Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body. Bring chest all the way to the floor and raise hands off the ground. | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight, raise one leg off the ground, and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Place feet on a stability ball, hands on the floor in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest toward the floor, then push up while tucking knees toward your chest. | 3. Extend legs back to starting position, maintaining control and stability throughout the movement.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place your feet on the stability ball. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
1. Hold your body with arms locked above the equipment | 2. Lower your body slowly while leaning forward, flare out your elbows | 3. Raise your body above the bars until your arms are locked.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up, clap hands. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.
1. Begin in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond shape under your chest. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.
1. Start in a push-up position. | 2. Lower your chest, explode up. | 3. Land softly, repeat for reps.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.
1. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body. Bring chest all the way to the floor and raise hands off the ground. | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight, raise one leg off the ground, and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place your feet on the stability ball. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.

1. Hover your heels just off the ground. | 2. Stick your chest out and maintain a flat back. Make all the movement happen at your mid and upper spine. | 3. Point your chest to the left, then rotate at the spine until your chest is pointed right.

1. Start with your elbow and hip on the ground. Either neutral fist or flat hand on the ground. | 2. Begin in a side plank position, and then drop your hips to the floor. | 3. Pull your hips back to the ceiling to finish the rep.

1. Begin in an elbow side plank position. | 2. Reach for the ceiling with your off hand. | 3. Rotate at the mid and upper spine and reach through the open space between the floor and your torso. | 4. Reach backwards, and then rotate back into the starting position.
1. Press your elbow into the floor. | 2. Pick your hips up off the ground and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time. | 3. Make sure you don't let your chest fall forward or backward.
1. Press your hand into the ground and pick up your hip off the ground. | 2. Open your chest and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.
1. Start in a side plank position. | 2. Reach your top arm under your body. | 3. Return to the plank position.
1. Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat. | 2. Reach right hand to right heel. | 3. Switch sides, left hand to left heel. Repeat.
1. Lie on back, arms out, legs together. | 2. Lift legs to 90 degrees. | 3. Rotate legs side to side, keeping shoulders grounded.
1. Lay flat on your back with both hands over one leg. | 2. Reach toward your knee flexing your abs and obliques. | 3. Do the prescribed amount of reps, then switch sides.
1. Lie on your side, knees bent, hands behind head. | 2. Bring your elbow towards your knees and flex your obliques.
1. Lie on your side, legs straight, hand behind head. | 2. Lift both legs and upper body simultaneously. | 3. Squeeze obliques, then lower back down. Repeat on both sides.

1. Start on all fours then bring your chest to the ground. Place one hand on the ground in front of you. The other hand behind your head/ear. | 2. On the side of the hand that is behind your head, rotate until your elbow is pointed at the ceiling and then hold this position.
1. Lie sideways on a stability ball, feet anchored, hands behind head, core engaged. | 2. Crunch sideways by contracting obliques, bringing your upper body toward your hip.
1. Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms backwards in small circles.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a pole overhead, using an overhand grip. | 2. Begin the squat by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your core tight and the dumbbells balanced overhead. | 3. Lower your body as far as you can while keeping the dumbbells overhead, then push back up to the starting position. | 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, making sure to keep your back straight, chest lifted, and the dumbbells stable overhead throughout the entire movement.

1. Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling. | 2. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows | 3. Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position. | 4. Repeat

1. Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms backwards in small circles.
1. Hold your arms out to your sides. | 2. Rotate your arms forward in small circles.

1. Stand facing rings and grab the handles. | 2. Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | 3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. | 2. flex your knees and hips and sit back into the squat while lowering your body | 3. Continue down to full depth | 4. Return to starting position.
1. Sit on your butt with your knees bent and feet touching each other. | 2. Grab your feet and lean forward until you feel a stretch in your groin.
1. Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg. | 2. Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a medicine ball. | 2. Circle the ball around your head, maintaining control. | 3. Complete the desired number of repetitions in both directions.
1. Lie facing partner, knees bent. | 2. Sit up, toss medicine ball to partner. | 3. Catch and lower down. Repeat for desired reps.
1. Place forearms on medicine ball, extend legs. | 2. Maintain straight body position for desired time.
1. Lift medicine ball overhead. | 2. Slam ball down to ground with force.
1. Lie on your back, holding a medicine ball overhead. | 2. Lift your shoulders and legs off the ground, engaging core. | 3. Hold the position while maintaining stability.

1. Lie on your back, place a medicine ball between your extended arms and bent knees. | 2. Lower opposite arm and leg to floor, keeping back pressed against ground and medicine ball in place. | 3. Alternate sides, maintain core engagement, and repeat for desired reps or time.
1. Place forearms on medicine ball, extend legs. | 2. Maintain straight body position for desired time.
1. Lie facing partner, knees bent. | 2. Sit up, toss medicine ball to partner. | 3. Catch and lower down. Repeat for desired reps.
1. Place forearms on medicine ball, extend legs. | 2. Maintain straight body position for desired time.
1. Lift medicine ball overhead. | 2. Slam ball down to ground with force.

Exercise Name: Medicine Ball Clean And Press Slam
Instructions: 1. Hold the medicine ball with an overhand grip. | 2. Lift the ball explosively, clean it to shoulder height. | 3. Press the ball overhead, then slam it to the ground.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding medicine ball close. | 2. Squat down, keeping ball close to head and chest. | 3. Stand back up, squeezing glutes. Repeat for desired reps.
1. Hold medicine ball at one shoulder, feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Squat down, keeping ball on same side throughout movement. | 3. Stand back up, squeezing glutes. Repeat on other side.
1. Hold medicine ball overhead. | 2. Step back into lunge position. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Hold medicine ball overhead. | 2. Squat down, keeping back straight. | 3. Stand back up. Repeat for desired reps.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Step back into lunge position. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Step back into lunge position, extend your arms, twist torso. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Toss medicine ball up, catch with both hands. | 2. Repeat toss and catch for desired reps.
1. Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg. | 2. Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Squat down, reach ball to one side. | 3. Stand up and repeat reach on other side.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest, facing wall. | 2. Squat down, then throw ball at wall. | 3. Catch and repeat for desired reps.
1. Stand tall with a medicine ball held against one hip. | 2. Lift the leg on the opposite side laterally. | 3. Lower the leg and repeat on the other side.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball. | 2. Step laterally, performing a lunge, then slam the ball. | 3. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Jump, extending arms overhead. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat for desired reps.

1. Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg. | 2. Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

Exercise Name: Medicine Ball Chest Press Partner Toss
Instructions: 1. Stand tall, partner tosses medicine ball to chest. | 2. Catch ball and press it back to partner. Repeat.
1. Place hands on medicine ball, in push-up position. | 2. Perform push-up, maintaining proper form.
1. Place one hand on medicine ball, other on ground. | 2. Perform push-up, walking hands to switch positions.

Instructions: 1. Stand tall, partner tosses medicine ball to chest. | 2. Catch ball and press it back to partner. Repeat.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest, feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Extend arms forward, slamming ball to the ground. | 3. Catch the ball on the rebound and repeat for reps.
1. Stand in front of a wall holding a medicine ball. | 2. Press the ball forward, extending arms and tossing it. | 3. Catch the ball and return to the starting position.
1. Place hands on medicine ball, in push-up position. | 2. Perform push-up, maintaining proper form.
1. Place one hand on medicine ball, other on ground. | 2. Perform push-up, walking hands to switch positions.

Exercise Name: Medicine Ball Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
Instructions: 1. Kneel with one knee down, holding a medicine ball. | 2. Rotate torso and until the medicine ball is pointed the opposite direction. | 3. Repeat the movement on the other side.
1. Kneel, holding a medicine ball. | 2. Rotate torso and slam the ball diagonally down and across. | 3. Repeat the movement on the other side.
1. Stand facing partner, side by side. | 2. Toss medicine ball to partner's side. | 3. Catch and repeat toss on other side.
1. Lift medicine ball overhead. | 2. Slam ball down to one side. | 3. Catch and repeat slam to the other side.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Step back into lunge position, extend your arms, twist torso. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Sit with knees bent, feet off ground. | 2. Twist torso side to side, touching medicine ball to ground.
1. Hold medicine ball with both hands and arms extended. | 2. Swing ball diagonally across body, engaging core.
1. Stand sideways next to a wall. | 2. Swing medicine ball across your body and toss off the wall. | 3. Catch and repeat toss on the other side.

Exercise Name: Medicine Ball Clean And Press Slam
Instructions: 1. Hold the medicine ball with an overhand grip. | 2. Lift the ball explosively, clean it to shoulder height. | 3. Press the ball overhead, then slam it to the ground.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a medicine ball. | 2. Circle the ball around your head, maintaining control. | 3. Complete the desired number of repetitions in both directions.
1. Hold medicine ball overhead. | 2. Step back into lunge position. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Jump, extending arms overhead. | 3. Return to starting position. Repeat for desired reps.
1. Toss medicine ball up, catch with both hands. | 2. Repeat toss and catch for desired reps.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest. | 2. Squat down, reach ball to one side. | 3. Stand up and repeat reach on other side.
1. Hold medicine ball at chest, facing wall. | 2. Squat down, then throw ball at wall. | 3. Catch and repeat for desired reps.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a medicine ball. | 2. Circle the ball around your head, maintaining control. | 3. Complete the desired number of repetitions in both directions.

1. Stand up straight with a kettlebell in both hands in front of your pelvis. | 2. Raise the kettlebell bending your arms at the elbow until the kettlebell is level with your chest. | 3. Lower to the starting position and repeat.

1. Sitting on a chair with your legs apart, rest your arm against your thigh and hold the kettlebell with your arm extended towards the floor. | 2. Bending your arm at the elbow, lift the kettlebell until your palm faces your shoulder. | 3. Lower to the starting position and repeat.

1. Stand behind a bench, with your chest leaning over the edge of the bench. | 2. With one arm resting on the bench, hold the kettlebell, bending the arm at the elbow. | 3. Lower your arm using the bench as a guide, keeping your forearm straight. | 4. Return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your upper chest and then lower the kettlebell- repeat.

1. Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand with your forearm facing out. | 2. Raise the kettlebell, bending your arm at the elbow and keeping your forearm vertical until your palm faces the shoulder. | 3. Lower to the starting position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same hand as the leg shifted backwards. | 2. Bend forwards at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knee, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell in one hand. | 2. Bend at hips, row kettlebell to chest. | 3. Alternate hands for each row.
1. Grab two kettlebells, stand tall. | 2. Curl kettlebells toward chest. | 3. Lower kettlebells, repeat.
1. Stand with kettlebell between legs. | 2. Hinge at hips, grab kettlebell, pull to chest and rotate at the torso
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in each hand, hinge at hips. | 2. Pull kettlebells while flaring your elbows, squeezing shoulder blades. Keep back flat.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. | 2. Hold kettlebell with palms facing down. | 3. Lift kettlebell toward shoulders, squeezing biceps, then lower with control.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a kettlebell in each hand. | 2. Hinge at hips, keep back straight, and pull both kettlebells to hips.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. | 2. Hold a kettlebell with palms facing down. | 3. Lift kettlebell toward shoulders, squeezing biceps, then lower with control.

Exercise Name: Kettlebell Single Arm Row On Bench
Instructions: 1. Start by standing in front of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a kettlebell in one hand. | 2. Place your other hand on the bench for support, and bend at the waist so that your chest is parallel to the ground. | 3. From this starting position, row the kettlebell up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blade together as you do so. | 4. Make sure to keep your elbow close to your body and your core engaged throughout the movement.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Return to standing position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.

1. Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides. | 2. Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in each hand, hinge at hips. | 2. Pull kettlebells while flaring your elbows, squeezing shoulder blades. Keep back flat.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold one kettlebell in each hand at your sides, and lean forward. | 2. Lift your shoulders backward while keeping arms straight. | 3. Lower shoulders back down, repeat for desired reps.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Return to standing position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell between your legs, with your knees slightly bent. | 2. Keeping your back straight, swing the kettlebell upwards until the kettlebell is level with your chest and carefully lower. | 3. Repeat

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, lifting one foot off the floor behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the lifted leg. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you extend your lifted leg behind you, keeping your back straight - holding out your arm to the side for balance. | 3. Return to the upright position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in both hands in front of your thighs. | 2. Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees and keep your back straight. | 3. Return to the upright position and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest. | 2. Bend forward at the hips keeping your back and knees straight and the kettlebell close to your chest. | 3. Return to standing position and thrust your pelvis forward.

1. Begin by lying face down on the floor with a kettlebell in each hand, arms extended. | 2. Lift your chest and legs off the ground simultaneously while squeezing your glutes and raising the kettlebells. | 3. Lower your body and kettlebells back to the floor, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in one hand, arm fully extended, and hinge at hips. | 2. Lift opposite leg straight behind you, forming a straight line from head to heel. | 3. Hold for 15-30 seconds, switch sides, and repeat for a balanced kettlebell superman hold.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs. | 2. Hinge at hips, swing kettlebell between legs. | 3. Swing kettlebell up, switch hands at the top, and repeat in a fluid motion.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. | 2. Bend at hips and knees to lift kettlebells. | 3. Stand tall, then lower.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells outside legs | 2. Hinge at hips, swing kettlebells forward, then back. | 3. Thrust hips to swing kettlebells upward, keeping arms straight.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs. | 2. Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and swing it overhead. | 3. Extend hips and knees, lock out arms at the top.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding kettlebells in front. | 2. Hinge at hips, keeping back straight, and lower kettlebells towards ground. | 3. Return to start position, squeezing glutes at the top.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs, grip with one hand, hinge at hips. | 2. Swing kettlebell forcefully forward, using hip thrust, arm straight. | 3. Swing kettlebell back between legs, repeat for desired reps.
1. Begin with feet hip-width apart, one foot forward, kettlebell between feet. | 2. Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and stand tall. | 3. Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.

1. Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat. | 2. Explosively thrust hips forward, swing kettlebell to chest height. | 3. Repeat for desired reps, keeping core engaged and maintaining a staggered stance for balance.

1. Stand with feet wide apart, toes pointing slightly outward, and kettlebell on the floor between your feet. | 2. Bend at hips and knees, keeping back straight, and grip the kettlebell handle. | 3. Lift the kettlebell by extending hips and knees, stand up straight, and return to the starting position.

1. Start with a kettlebell between your legs, hinge at hips, swing it upward. | 2. Lift kettlebell to chest level, elbows high, engaging shoulders. | 3. Lower kettlebell back down, maintaining control. Repeat for desired reps.

1. Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a kettlebell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs. | 2. Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the kettlebell down towards the ground. | 3. As the kettlebell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position. | 4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the kettlebell on the opposite side of your body.

1. Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell in a goblet position. | 2. Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up. | 3. Push through your heels to return to the standing position.

1. Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar. | 2. Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time. | 3. Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring. | 4. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

1. Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. | 2. Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | 3. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

1. Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell. | 2. Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | 3. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Exercise Name: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift
Instructions: 1. Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell in a goblet position. | 2. Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings. | 3. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

1. Lay flat on your back with straight legs and hold the kettle bell above your chest at arms length. | 2. Draw your belly into the base of your spine to engage the muscles, then raise your head and shoulders off the floor with the kettlebell raised at arms length above your chest. | 3. Return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Sit on the floor with your legs bent, knees together and feet raised slightly off the floor. | 2. Starting on one side and sitting up straight with your core muscles engaged, lift the kettlebell off the floor with both hands and bring it across your body to the other side, rotating your chest towards the floor as you do so. | 3. Tap the kettlebell lightly on the floor and bring the kettlebell back across your body to the starting position, rotating your chest towards the floor. | 4. Repeat, keeping the legs bent and feet raised throughout the exercise.

1. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and extend your arm above your head. | 2. Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell above your head, lower the relaxed arm towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm. | 3. Return to the starting potion, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.
1. Grab a kettlebell. | 2. Lie on your back, lift legs & shoulders off floor. | 3. Hold kettlebell above your head, engage core, and maintain position.
1. Hold kettlebells in front rack. | 2. Step back and lunge diagonally.
1. Start with kettlebells in front rack. | 2. Step forward into lunge. | 3. Return to starting position.
1. Hold kettlebell in front rack. | 2. Step sideways into a lunge position. | 3. Return to start position. Repeat.
1. Start with kettlebell in front rack. | 2. Step back into lunge. | 3. Return to start position.

Instructions: 1. Hold kettlebell in front rack. | 2. Step sideways, lunge.
1. Hold kettlebells close to chest. | 2. Squat down, keeping chest up. | 3. Stand up, extending hips fully.

Instructions: 1. Hold kettlebell in front rack position. | 2. Step forward, lunge. Bringing your back knee to the floor. | 3. Extend your knee and return to the starting position.

Instructions: 1. Stand in front of a step or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell at one shoulder. | 2. Step up onto the bench with your right foot, pushing off your foot to raise your body up onto the bench.

1. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in your bottom hand and extend the other arm above your head. | 2. Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell inside your thigh, lower the kettlebell towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm. | 3. Return to the starting position, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.

1. Lay flat on your back with straight legs and hold the kettle bell above your chest at arms length. | 2. Draw your belly into the base of your spine to engage the muscles, then raise your head and shoulders off the floor with the kettlebell raised at arms length above your chest. | 3. Return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the same foot as the side without the kettlebell off the floor. | 2. Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in each hand, raise your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 2. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Sitting comfortably on a chair with your core stomach muscles engaged, place your feet on the floor. | 2. Place the kettlebell on your legs, just above the knees and raise your heels upwards off the floor. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Stand tall with your feet on the ground. You can put the the balls of your feet on top of a plate to extend the range of motion. | 2. Imagine you have a string attached to your heels and pull your heels up toward the ceiling.

1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in a goblet position, raise your heels upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 2. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Instructions: 1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the opposing foot off the floor. | 2. Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Place your hands on the barbell for support, and lift your heels off the ground. | 3. Hold this position for a moment, then slowly lower your heels back to the ground.

Place the kettlebell on your legs, just above the knees and raise your heels upwards off the floor. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Start by sitting on a bench with a barbell resting on your knees. Your feet should be flat on the ground, about hip-width apart. | 2. Place your hands on the barbell for support, and lift your heels off the ground. | 3. Hold this position for a moment, then slowly lower your heels back to the ground.

1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the same foot as the side without the kettlebell off the floor. | 2. Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

1. Stand tall with your feet on the ground. You can put the the balls of your feet on top of a plate to extend the range of motion. | 2. Imagine you have a string attached to your heels and pull your heels up toward the ceiling.

Instructions: 1. Standing straight with a kettlebell in one hand, lift the opposing foot off the floor. | 2. Raise your heel upwards while keeping your knees stationary. | 3. Pause when your heels are fully extended and then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same hand as the leg shifted backwards. | 2. Bend forwards at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knee, keeping your back straight. | 3. Lift the kettlebell upwards towards your chest and lower - repeat.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell in one hand. | 2. Bend at hips, row kettlebell to chest. | 3. Alternate hands for each row.
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. | 2. Hold kettlebell with palms facing down. | 3. Lift kettlebell toward shoulders, squeezing biceps, then lower with control.
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a kettlebell in each hand. | 2. Hinge at hips, keep back straight, and pull both kettlebells to hips.
