1. Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion. | 2. Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly. | 3. Then press back into the original position.

1. Place a plate on your back. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape. | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Use a dip belt to attach a plate to yourself. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Place a plate on your back. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape. | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

1. Place a plate on your back. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape. | 2. Use a standard push up position | 3. Lower your chest towards your hands, keep your elbows close to your body | 4. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.

1. Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head. | 2. Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead. | 3. As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate. | 4. Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.
1. Stand tall with a weight plate overhead. | 2. Elevated and depress your scapula. | 3. Avoid leaning forward or backwards to keep pressure off of your lumbar spine.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight plate in front of your chest with both hands. | 2. Keep your back straight, lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair. | 3. Go as low as you can while keeping your heels flat on the ground, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.

1. Stand holding a weight plate at chest height with both hands. | 2. Lower into a squat, extending the plate in front of you at chest height | 3. As you stand back up, pull the plate back into your chest.

1. Hold the plate with both hands at chest height. | 2. Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground. | 3. Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight. | 4. Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso. | 2. Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot. | 5. Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

1. Lower into a squat position, keeping the plate at chest height. | 2. Slowly curl the plate towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body. | 3. Hold for a moment at the top of the curl before lowering the plate back to chest height. | 4. Repeat the curls as you hold the squat position.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso. | 2. Take a step to the side with one foot, bending the knee and lowering the hips into a lunge. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping to the other side with the other foot.

1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and the plate held in front of the torso. | 2. Take a step forward with one foot, bending the front knee to lower the hips into a lunge. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping forward with the other foot.

1. Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees. | 2. Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest. | 3. Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

1. Hold the plate at chest height close to your body | 2. Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. | 3. Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position. | 4. Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

1. Hold a weight plate at arm's length overhead, with your arms fully extended. The plate should be directly above your head and your elbows should be locked. | 2. Begin to bend your knees, lowering your body as far as you can while keeping the weight plate overhead. Make sure to keep your back straight and your chest lifted. | 3. Once your thighs are parallel to the ground or as low as you can go, pause for a moment. | 4. Push through your heels to return to a standing position, keeping the weight plate overhead the entire time.

1. Stand on a plate with both feet. | 2. Step back with one foot to the floor and let your back knee get close to or tap the floor. | 3. Push through your front leg until both feet are back on the plate.

1. Stand tall with a plate overhead. | 2. Step with one foot forward bringing your back knee to the floor. Gently tap your knee then drive through your front leg. | 3. Go back to a standing position and then step forward with the opposing legs.

1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, with a weight plate held in both hands at chest height. | 2. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your weight in your heels. | 3. Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then pause for a moment. | 4. Hold the squat position for the desired amount of time, keeping the weight plate steady and your core engaged.

1. Start with the plate at chest height. Begin a squat. | 2. Make sure to hit parallel depth. On your way back up, use the momentum you generate with your legs to help push the plate into an overhead position. | 3. Let the plate return to chest height before initiating the next squat.

1. Press your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart, holding weights at your sides. | 2. Lower into a squat position, thighs parallel to the floor, knees above ankles. | 3. Hold the position, maintaining tension in your core and legs.

1. Stand on a platform, Holding a plate to your chest, feet hip-width apart. | 2. Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged. | 3. Push through front foot, return to start.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso. | 2. Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot. | 5. Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso. | 2. Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot. | 5. Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso. | 2. Step back and across the body with the right foot, bending both legs to lower into a lunge position. | 3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position. | 4. Repeat on the other side by stepping back and across with the left foot. | 5. Continue alternating sides for desired reps.

1. Start in a pushup position with both hands on a plate. This will extend your range of motion. | 2. Break at the elbows and shoulders until your upper arm travels behind the body slightly. | 3. Then press back into the original position.

Exercise Name: Plate Glute Bridge to Chest Press
Instructions: 1. Lay flat on the ground with a plate on your chest. | 2. Push your hips up toward the ceiling and maintain that extended position. | 3. With your hips up, press the plate toward the ceiling.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place a plate on your back. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Use a dip belt to attach a plate to yourself. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Place your hands firmly on the ground, directly under shoulders. Place a plate on your back. | 2. Flatten your back so your entire body is straight and slowly lower your body | 3. Draw shoulder blades back and down, keeping elbows tucked close to your body | 4. Exhale as you push back to the starting position.
1. Begin in a push-up position on your knees. Break at the elbow and shoulder joint. | 2. Lower your body, keeping elbows close. | 3. Push back up to the starting position.

1. Use a dip belt to attach a plate to yourself. Grip bars with arms straight, shoulders above hands. Keep legs straight or bent. | 2. Lower slowly until elbows are at 90 degrees. | 3. Push back up to start position, extending arms fully.

1. Step back with your right foot into a lunge position, both knees bent at 90 degrees. | 2. Twist your torso to the right, keeping the plate close to your chest. | 3. Push through your front foot to return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
1. Stand straight with the plate held at your side | 2. Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly | 3. Return to the upright position. | 4. Switch hands and repeat

1. Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground | 2. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button toward your spine. | 3. Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your back straight. | 4. Hold for a second and then twist to the left, holding for another second.

1. Stand with a plate extended away from your body. Elbows mostly extended. | 2. Rotate at the upper spine while keeping your lumbar spine in a neutral position. | 3. Do not let the plate go behind your body.

1. Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the plate near one of your quads. | 2. Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques. | 3. You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

1. Stand facing the plate with your feet shoulder-width apart and the plate positioned between your feet. | 2. Bend down and grasp the plate from the top edges with both hands, making sure your thumbs and fingers are evenly spaced. | 3. Keep your back straight, chest up and core engaged, and stand up with the plate, keeping it close to your body. | 4. Lower the plate back down to the ground, keeping control and maintaining good posture.
1. Stand tall holding two plates in each hand with a pinch grip. | 2. Walk for the desired distance or time.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the feet. | 2. Bend the knees and hips to pick up the plate, keeping the back straight and core engaged. | 3. Stand up, lock the hips and legs, and press the plate overhead with straight arms. | 4. Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

1. Stand holding a weight plate at chest height with both hands. | 2. Lower into a squat, extending the plate in front of you at chest height | 3. As you stand back up, pull the plate back into your chest.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward. | 2. Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body. | 3. Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms. | 4. Lower the plate back to the starting position, keeping control of it, and repeat for desired reps.

1. Hold the plate with both hands at chest height. | 2. Keeping your core tight and your chest up, squat down as low as you can go while keeping your feet flat on the ground. | 3. Hold the squat position and reach the plate forward, keeping your arms straight and your back straight. | 4. Return the plate to your chest while you hold the squat position and repeat reaching the plate in front of you

Exercise Name: Plate Curl To Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
Instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing forward. | 2. Curl the plate up to the front of the shoulder while keeping the elbows close to the body. | 3. Rotate the palms to face forward and press the plate overhead, locking out the arms. | 4. Lower the plate back behind the head to the starting position of a tricep extension. | 5. Push the plate back up overhead, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

1. Inhale and brace your abdominals | 2. Raise the arms vertically while keeping the elbows slightly bent | 3. Once the arms are parallel with the floor, rotate the plate clockwise and counterclockwise. | 4. Lower the plate back to the starting position.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate in front of the torso, palms facing the thighs. | 2. Keeping the elbows slightly bent, lift the plate up to the front of the body. | 3. Raise the plate up until the arms are fully extended, maintaining control of the plate. | 4. Lower the plate back to the starting position and repeat for desired reps.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the plate held in front of your face with both hands, palms facing each other. | 2. Rotate the plate around the head, keeping the arms extended and moving the plate in a circular motion. | 3. Complete one full circle, then reverse the direction to complete another circle.

Exercise Name: Plate Overhead Press To Tricep Extension
Instructions: 1. Brace your core and press the weight plate overhead until your arms are fully extended. Keep your shoulders down and back. | 2. While your arms are fully extended, lower the weight behind your head to perform the extension | 3. After completing the extension, lower the weight to your chest, and perform the overhead press. Repeat

1. Stand tall holding two plates at your side. | 2. Lateral raise the plates to your side and continue until the plates are pointed at the ceiling. | 3. Let your shoulder joint naturally rotate. At the bottom you should have a neutral or overhand grip. By the time the plates are overhead, your palms should be facing forward.

1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip two plates in each hand at your sides. | 2. Keeping your arms straight, raise the plates out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders. | 3. Lower the plates back to your sides with control. Repeat for desired number of reps.

1. Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head. | 2. Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead. | 3. As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate. | 4. Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.

1. Start with the plate at chest height. Begin a squat. | 2. Make sure to hit parallel depth. On your way back up, use the momentum you generate with your legs to help push the plate into an overhead position. | 3. Let the plate return to chest height before initiating the next squat.
1. Start in a standing position with a plate against your chest. | 2. Press the plate away from your body until your elbows are extended.

Exercise Name: Plate Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
Instructions: 1. With plates in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Hinge forward with a flat back. | 2. Maintain an overhand grip and internally rotated shoulders. | 3. Raise your arms backward toward the ceiling while maintaining a light band in your elbows.

1. Keep your back straight and bend forward slightly at the waist. | 2. With arms extended, raise the weights out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders. | 3. Pause briefly and then lower the weights back to the starting position.
1. Hold the TRX straps with an underhand grip and lean back and away from the anchor point. | 2. Keep your elbows high as you flex your elbows. Pull your fists toward your forehead.
1. Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Maintain a neutral grip. Flex your elbows and pull your fists to either sides of your temples.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing away from your body. | 2. Walk back until the straps are taut, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.

1. Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the strap is taut. | 2. Start with an overhand grip. Pull your elbows back and rotate your grip. | 3. By the time your elbows reach your side, your palms should be facing upwards.

1. Hold the TRX strap with one hand. | 2. Lean back until the strap is taut. Fully extend your elbow. | 3. Pull your elbow behind the body. Make sure to avoid twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | 3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point. | 3. Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body. | 4. Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

1. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 2. Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | 3. Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged. | 4. When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.

1. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 2. Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | 3. Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged. | 4. When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.

1. Lie face down on the ground and place your forearms on the ground directly under your shoulders. | 2. With your feet in the stirrups, kick both feet into the TRX straps and hold the handles above your head. | 3. Tighten your abs, glutes, and legs to form a straight line from your head to your feet.

1. Start by facing away from the TRX straps and placing your feet in the TRX handles with your palms on the ground. | 2. Lift your knees off the ground to begin the set. | 3. Engage your core and maintain this position for the desired amount of time, holding a steady plank.

1. Begin in a kneeling position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. | 2. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 3. Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | 4. Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged.
1. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position. | 2. Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

1. Start in a plank position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups. | 2. Keep your abs engaged, and bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended behind you. | 3. Switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest while keeping your abs engaged and your back straight.
1. Place your feet in the stirrups and get in to a plank position. | 2. Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling. | 3. Lower your hips until you're back in a plank position.
1. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position. | 2. Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

1. Start in a plank position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups. | 2. Keep your abs engaged, and bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended behind you. | 3. Switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest while keeping your abs engaged and your back straight.
1. Place your feet in the stirrups and get in to a plank position. | 2. Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling. | 3. Lower your hips until you're back in a plank position.

1. Hold the TRX straps under your arms and the handles in your armpits. | 2. Lean forward against the straps. | 3. Keep your body straight and initiate the calf raise by raising your heels off the ground.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing away from your body. | 2. Walk back until the straps are taut, keeping your arms straight. | 3. Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.

1. Stand facing away from the anchor point, holding onto the TRX handles with both hands. | 2. Step your left foot behind your right, crossing it behind your right leg, and lower yourself into a curtsy lunge. | 3. Push through your right foot to return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg.

1. Lie on your back with your feet in the foot cradles of the TRX straps, with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. | 2. Place your arms by your sides with your palms facing down. | 3. Drive your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings at the top of the movement.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and place your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Begin by lowering into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up. | 3. Explosively jump up off the ground, using your arms for momentum if desired. | 4. Land softly back in the squat position, making sure to absorb the impact with your legs.

1. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands and extend your arms straight in front of you. | 2. Step laterally to one side, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. | 3. Lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back leg straight. | 4. Push off your front foot to return to the starting position, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged.

1. Hold on to the TRX straps and step away until the strap is taut. | 2. Step backwards with one leg in to a lunge position and gently tap your knee to the floor. | 3. Lunge back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.

1. Hold the two TRX straps and step away until the straps are taut. Take a split stance. | 2. Bring your back knee to the floor and gently tap the floor. | 3. Use your arms and the TRX to help assist you getting back into the starting position.

1. Hold the two TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Flex at the hips and knees in to a squat position. | 3. You can use your arms and the straps to assist you back into the starting position.

1. Start by facing the TRX straps and positioning yourself in a push-up position with your hands on the ground and your feet in the TRX foot cradles. | 2. Keeping your core engaged and body in a straight line, bend your knees and bring your heels towards your glutes. | 3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

1. Start by facing the TRX straps and positioning yourself in a push-up position with your hands on the ground and your feet in the TRX foot cradles. | 2. Keeping your core engaged and body in a straight line, bend your knees and bring your heels towards your glutes. | 3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

1. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 2. Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | 3. Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged. | 4. When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.

1. Begin in a kneeling position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. | 2. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 3. Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you. | 4. Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged.

1. Grab the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the strap is taut. | 2. Start with an overhand grip. Pull your elbows back and rotate your grip. | 3. By the time your elbows reach your side, your palms should be facing upwards.

1. Hold the TRX strap with one hand. | 2. Lean back until the strap is taut. Fully extend your elbow. | 3. Pull your elbow behind the body. Make sure to avoid twisting. Try to keep your shoulders even.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. | 2. Keeping your core engaged, slowly raise your arms forward until they are overhead. | 3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

1. Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | 3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point. | 3. Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body. | 4. Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | 2. Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | 3. You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | 2. Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | 3. You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. | 2. Keeping your core engaged, slowly raise your arms forward until they are overhead. | 3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

1. Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | 2. Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | 3. You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | 3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point. | 3. Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body. | 4. Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

1. Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.
1. Hold the two TRX straps and lean forward. The straps should be over each shoulder. | 2. Keep your elbows tucked in and then flex and extend at the elbows.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | 2. Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | 3. You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

1. Stand facing away from the anchor point, holding onto the TRX handles with both hands. | 2. Step your left foot behind your right, crossing it behind your right leg, and lower yourself into a curtsy lunge. | 3. Push through your right foot to return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and place your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Begin by lowering into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up. | 3. Explosively jump up off the ground, using your arms for momentum if desired. | 4. Land softly back in the squat position, making sure to absorb the impact with your legs.

1. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands and extend your arms straight in front of you. | 2. Step laterally to one side, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. | 3. Lower your body into a lunge position, keeping your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back leg straight. | 4. Push off your front foot to return to the starting position, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged.

1. Hold on to the TRX straps and step away until the strap is taut. | 2. Step backwards with one leg in to a lunge position and gently tap your knee to the floor. | 3. Lunge back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.

1. Hold the two TRX straps and step away until the straps are taut. Take a split stance. | 2. Bring your back knee to the floor and gently tap the floor. | 3. Use your arms and the TRX to help assist you getting back into the starting position.

1. Hold the two TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Flex at the hips and knees in to a squat position. | 3. You can use your arms and the straps to assist you back into the starting position.

1. Start by adjusting the TRX straps to chest height. Stand facing the TRX with your feet shoulder-width apart. | 2. Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears. | 3. Lean forward, keeping your arms extended and your core engaged. Your body should form a slight diagonal line from your ankles to your head. | 4. Slowly bring your arms towards each other, in front of your chest, while keeping your core engaged and your body in a stable position.

1. Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and your feet resting in the TRX foot cradles. | 2. Prop yourself up on your forearm and engage your core to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet.

1. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position. | 2. Pull both knees to your right elbow. | 3. Extend your legs back to the starting position, then pull both knees to the left elbow.

1. Stand facing the TRX straps and hold onto the handles with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. | 2. Keeping your core engaged, slowly raise your arms forward until they are overhead. | 3. Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.

1. Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them. | 2. Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders. | 3. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line. | 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point until the straps are taut. | 2. Keep both elbows mostly extended and raise both arms out and upwards. | 3. You should make a Y shape with your arms during the back portion of the exercise.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels. | 3. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a "T" shape.

1. Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands. | 2. Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point. | 3. Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body. | 4. Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.

1. Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point. | 2. Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.

1. Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides. | 2. Close your eyes and take deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth. | 3. Allow your body to completely relax and let go of any tension. | 4. Hold for several minutes and then slowly come back up to a seated position.

1. Begin in a squatting position with your feet together and your knees apart. | 2. Place your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart. Keep your arms straight and engage your core. | 3. Slowly shift your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground, coming onto your tiptoes. | 4. Bend your elbows and lean your weight onto your hands, shifting your knees towards your upper arms. | 5. Gently lift one foot off the ground, and then the other, balancing on your hands. Hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart. | 2. Spread your fingers wide and press down into your palms, making sure that your fingers are evenly spaced and facing forward. | 3. Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible. | 4. Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted "V" shape. | 5. Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground. | 6. Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.

Exercise Name: Downward Dog With Fingers Facing Feet
Instructions: 1. Begin in the same starting position as the previous exercise, with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Spread your fingers wide and turn your hands so that your fingers are facing towards your feet. | 3. Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible. | 4. Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted "V" shape. | 5. Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground. | 6. Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.

1. Begin in a downward-facing dog pose. | 2. Slowly lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping your hips level and your toes pointed. | 3. Bend your lifted leg and try to touch your toes to the back of your head. | 4. Once you have a firm grip with your toes, slowly begin to twist your torso towards the lifted leg. | 5. Keep your hands and feet firmly planted on the ground as you hold the pose for a few breaths. Release the pose and repeat on the other side.

1. Sit cross-legged on the floor. | 2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing forward. | 3. Cross your right arm over your left arm and interlace your fingers. | 4. Pull your hands away from your body and hold for a few breaths, then release and repeat with the opposite arm on top.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | 2. Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor. | 3. Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees. | 4. Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.

1. Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | 3. Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | 4. Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side. | 5. Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | 6. Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | 7. Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | 8. Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

Exercise Name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands Beginner
Instructions: 1. Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground. | 2. Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart. | 3. Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. | 4. Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

Exercise Name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands
Instructions: 1. Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | 2. Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart. | 3. Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. | 4. Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

1. Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh. | 3. Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling. | 4. Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. | 2. Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest. | 3. Reach inside your knees and hold onto the outside edges of your feet. | 4. Gently pull your knees towards your armpits and rock side to side for a few breaths.

1. Start by lying down on your stomach on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface. | 2. Place your elbows underneath your shoulders, keeping your forearms parallel to each other. | 3. Press your palms and forearms firmly into the ground to lift your chest up, while keeping your hips and legs relaxed. | 4. Make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears. Gently roll your shoulder blades down and back to open up your chest. | 5. Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling, while keeping your chin tucked in slightly.
1. Start prone, hands under shoulders. | 2. Inhale, lift chest, arch back. | 3. Elongate neck, gaze up. Breathe, hold. Release, exhale.

1. Lie down on your back with your feet hip-distance apart and your knees bent. | 2. Place your hands on the floor beside your head, fingertips pointing towards your shoulders. | 3. Push your feet and hands into the floor, lift your hips up and straighten your arms. | 4. Lift your chest towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths before lowering back down.
1. Start prone, hands under shoulders. | 2. Inhale, lift chest, arch back. | 3. Elongate neck, gaze up. Breathe, hold. Release, exhale.

1. Begin in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. | 2. Lift your right foot off the mat and place your right toes on top of your left heel. | 3. Press your palms and fingers firmly into the mat and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, deepening the stretch in your hamstrings and calves. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly walking your hands back out to a downward-facing dog position.

1. Start standing with a flat and vertical block on the matt | 2. Bend forward, placing hand on vertical block, and front of foot on the flat block. | 3. Press the bottom of your foot towards the ground, and repeat on each side.

1. Begin in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. | 2. Walk your feet towards your hands, bending your knees as needed to allow your heels to touch the mat. | 3. Press your palms and fingers into the mat and lift your hips up towards the ceiling to deepen the stretch in your hamstrings and calves. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly walking your hands back out to a downward-facing dog position.

1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | 2. Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards the sides of your mat and the tops of your hands are on the floor. | 3. Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears. | 4. Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. | 2. Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards your knees and the tops of your hands are on the floor. | 3. Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears. | 4. Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

1. Come onto your hands and knees on the mat with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | 2. Turn your palms down and spread your fingers wide, with your fingertips pointing towards your knees. | 3. Press into your palms and extend your arms fully to lift your shoulders away from your ears. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly lowering your hands to the mat and coming back to a neutral tabletop position.

1. Begin in a kneeling position with your knees together and your shins and feet on the floor. | 2. Sit back on your heels and place your palms face down on your thighs, with your fingers pointing towards your knees. | 3. Relax your shoulders and take deep breaths. | 4. Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.

1. Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Place a block under your left knee, then bend your right knee and stack it on top of your left ankle. | 3. Flex both feet and gently press your knees towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your hips. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Sit on a yoga mat with legs straight in front of you. | 2. Bend the right knee and place the right foot on top of the left thigh. Allow the right knee to fall towards the floor. | 3. Bring the left foot onto the right thigh. Keep the spine straight and rest hands on the knees. | 4. Hold for several breaths and then release.

1. Extend your right leg behind you and place your right ankle on top of your left thigh, with your right knee pointing out to the side. | 2. Sitting up straight, use your hands to gently press down on your right knee while at the same time pulling your left buttock back. | 3. Hold for 5-10 deep breaths, then release and repeat on the other side.

1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and your feet on the ground. | 2. Cross your right ankle over your left knee, creating a figure four shape. | 3. Use your hands to gently pull your left knee towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your right hip. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Start in a seated position with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Cross your right leg over your left leg, placing your right foot on the floor beside your left hip. | 3. Cross your left leg over your right leg, placing your left foot on the floor beside your right hip. | 4. Relax your arms by your sides or place them on your abdomen and take deep breaths.

1. Start in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the floor. | 2. Step your right foot forward, placing it between your hands. | 3. Straighten your right leg and flex your toes towards your face, keeping your hands on the floor for support. | 4. Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, keeping your spine long. | 3. Reach for your feet or ankles, keeping your elbows straight. | 4. Hold for several breaths, then release.

1. Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose) with two blocks at the top of your mat. | 2. Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward. | 3. Place the blocks on either side of your right foot at a height that allows you to comfortably place your hands on them. | 4. Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the blocks. Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose). | 2. Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward. | 3. Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the floor on either side of your right foot. | 4. Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a block on the ground in front of you. | 2. Hinge forward at your hips and place your hands on the block. | 3. Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart. | 2. Hinge forward at your hips, reaching your hands towards the ground. | 3. Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

1. Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | 2. Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and raise it off the ground, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | 3. Inhale and reach your arms forward, parallel to the ground. | 4. Exhale and hinge forward at your hips, bringing your torso parallel to the ground and extending your left leg straight back. Keep your arms and right leg straight and hold the pose for a few breaths | 5. inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

Exercise Name: Wide Legged Standing Forward Bend Holding Heels
Instructions: 1. Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | 2. Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | 3. Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you. | 3. Rest your forehead on the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release.

Exercise Name: Child Pose Arms Extended Left Right
Instructions: 1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you to one side. | 3. Rest your forehead on the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Sit back onto your heels and place your arms at your sides with your palms facing up. | 3. Rest your forehead on the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release.

1. Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | 2. Place your right hand on a block or the ground on the outside of your right foot. | 3. Reach your left arm overhead and then round your spine, bringing your left hand to your right ear. | 4. Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

Exercise Name: Extended side Angle Pose With Block
Instructions: 1. Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back. | 2. Place a block on the outside of your right foot and place your right hand on top of it. | 3. Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

Exercise Name: Gate Pose Rounding Spine Looking Up
Instructions: 1. Begin in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart. | 2. Extend your right leg out to the side, placing your foot flat on the ground. | 3. Reach your right arm overhead and then round your spine, bringing your right hand to your left ear. | 4. Look down towards your left foot as you reach your left arm towards your right foot, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.

1. Begin in a comfortable seated position on your mat, with your legs crossed and your spine straight. | 2. Extend your right arm up toward the ceiling and bend it at the elbow, bringing your right hand behind your head. | 3. Reach your left arm behind your back and bend it at the elbow, bringing your left hand up between your shoulder blades. | 4. Clasp your hands behind your back, trying to touch your fingertips together. If you can't quite reach, you can use a strap or towel to bridge the gap between your hands.

1. Begin seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | 2. Inhale and reach your arms out to the sides at shoulder height. | 3. Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms to touch if possible. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release the arms and repeat with the left arm over the right.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | 2. Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers. | 3. Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under. | 4. Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up. | 5. Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

1. Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | 2. Interlace your fingers behind your back and inhale to expand your chest. | 3. Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Walk your hands forward as you lower your chest towards the ground. | 3. Keep your hips over your knees and extend your arms out in front of you. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release.

1. Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | 2. Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up. | 3. Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest. | 4. Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | 2. Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers. | 3. Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under. | 4. Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up. | 5. Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

1. Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | 2. Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up. | 3. Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest. | 4. Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | 2. Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers. | 3. Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under. | 4. Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up. | 5. Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

1. Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | 2. Interlace your fingers behind your back and inhale to expand your chest. | 3. Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

1. Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | 2. Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up. | 3. Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest. | 4. Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Walk your hands forward as you lower your chest towards the ground. | 3. Keep your hips over your knees and extend your arms out in front of you. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release.

1. Place two blocks on the floor, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Kneel in front of the blocks, and lower your torso down so that your elbows are resting on the blocks, and your forehead is resting on the floor. | 3. Relax your arms, shoulders, and neck, and breathe deeply. | 4. Hold for a few breaths, then release.

1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Bend your left knee and place your left foot on the floor, close to your right hip. | 3. Cross your right leg over your left leg, stacking your knees on top of each other. | 4. Bring your left arm up overhead, and bend your elbow so that your left hand reaches towards your upper back. Reach your right hand behind your back and try to clasp your left hand. Hold

1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place your hands on a table, chair, or any elevated surface in front of you. | 2. Walk your feet back until your torso is parallel to the ground, and your elbows are resting on the surface. | 3. Relax your head and neck, and breathe deeply. | 4. Hold for a few breaths, then release.

1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. | 2. Cross your right arm over your left arm, bringing your palms together in front of your chest. | 3. Lower your arms down so that your palms face down towards the ground, and your right elbow is resting on top of your left elbow. | 4. Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

1. Sit cross-legged on the floor and bring your arms out to the sides at shoulder height. | 2. Cross your right arm over your left, bending both elbows so that your forearms are parallel to the floor. | 3. Lift your elbows towards the ceiling and bring your hands together, then drop your chin towards your chest. | 4. Hold for a few breaths, then release your arms and repeat on the other side.

1. Begin by sitting cross-legged on the floor. | 2. Slowly drop your chin towards your chest, feeling a stretch in the back of your neck. | 3. Inhale and lift your head up, then exhale and drop your right ear towards your right shoulder. | 4. Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat the stretch.

1. Sit cross-legged on the floor and interlace your fingers behind your head. | 2. Drop your chin to your chest and roll your head to the right, bringing your right ear towards your right shoulder. | 3. Slowly roll your head back to center, then over to the left so that your left ear is close to your left shoulder. | 4. Repeat the movement from side to side, keeping your shoulders relaxed and breathing deeply.

Exercise Name: Thread The Needle Hip Over Knees
Instructions: 1. Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. | 2. Slide your right knee up between your hands and place your right foot close to your left wrist. | 3. Take your left leg back and lower it down to the ground, keeping your toes tucked. | 4. Twist your torso to the right and reach your right arm underneath your left arm, threading the needle. Hold for a few breaths, then switch sides.

1. Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | 2. Inhale and raise your arms straight up over your head. | 3. Exhale and bend your knees, lowering your hips as if you were sitting in a chair. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and stand up straight.

1. Begin in Runner's Lunge pose with your right foot forward. | 2. Slowly lift your torso up and bring your arms overhead, palms facing each other. | 3. Make sure your right knee is directly above your ankle, and your left leg is straight behind you. | 4. Hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

1. Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby. | 2. Place the block at the highest height under your left hand. | 3. Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle. | 4. Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

Exercise Name: Crescent Moon Pose Quad Stretch With Block
Instructions: 1. Begin in Crescent Moon Pose with your right foot forward and a block nearby. | 2. Place the block at the highest height under your left hand. | 3. Reach your left arm behind you and take hold of your left foot or ankle. | 4. Gently pull your foot towards your buttocks while pressing your left hand into the block to deepen the stretch in your left quad. Hold for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other side.

1. Begin by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart. | 2. Shift your weight onto your left foot and bring your right heel towards your glute. | 3. Reach your right arm back and grab onto the inside of your right foot or ankle. | 4. Inhale and lift your right foot away from your glute while extending your left arm forward. Hold for 5-10 breaths before switching sides.

1. Begin in a low lunge with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground. | 2. Slowly slide your left knee back while extending your right leg forward, keeping both legs straight. | 3. Lower your body down to the ground, using your hands for support if needed. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

1. Begin in Downward Facing Dog pose (Adho Mukha Svanasana). | 2. Step your right foot forward between your hands. | 3. Place your left knee on the ground behind you and slide it back until you feel a stretch in your left hip flexor. | 4. Keep your hands on the ground or lift them to the sky and hold for a few breaths before repeating on the other side.

1. Lie on your stomach with your arms at your sides. | 2. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks. | 3. Reach back with your hands and grab your ankles. | 4. Inhale and lift your chest off the ground, pulling your legs up and back with your hands. | 5. Keep your gaze forward and hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.

1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. | 2. Press your feet into the ground and engage your leg muscles. | 3. Lift your chest and roll your shoulders back and down. | 4. Take a deep breath in, and as you exhale, release any tension in your body and relax your muscles.

1. Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you. | 2. Place a yoga block behind you, horizontally, at the base of your spine. | 3. Slowly recline over the block, supporting yourself with your forearms, until your back is resting on the block. | 4. Relax your arms at your sides, palms facing up, and breathe deeply.

1. Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | 2. Shift your weight onto your left foot and bend your right knee, bringing the sole of your right foot to the inside of your left thigh. | 3. Bring your hands together in front of your heart, or raise them overhead. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat on the other side.

1. Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | 2. Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | 3. Inhale and raise your arms overhead, then exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle. | 4. Hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

1. Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. | 2. Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and turn it slightly inward, while keeping your right foot facing forward. | 3. Inhale and raise your arms to shoulder height, parallel to the ground, with your palms facing down. | 4. Exhale and bend your right knee, bringing it directly over your ankle while keeping your left leg straight. | 5. Look over your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths, then inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

1. Stand facing a wall with your arms extended and your palms pressing into the wall at shoulder height. | 2. Slowly begin to walk your feet away from the wall, keeping your arms straight and your hands pressing into the wall. | 3. Walk until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a 45-degree angle to the ground. | 4. Repeat From High to Low Angles starting above the shoulder, and ending below the chest.

Exercise Name: Gate Pose Variation Arm Extended on Side
Instructions: 1. Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side. | 2. Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room. | 3. Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh. | 4. Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. | 2. Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your perineum. | 3. Place your left hand on the outside of your right knee and twist your body to the right. | 4. Reach your right hand towards your left foot and look up towards the ceiling. Hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

1. Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed. | 2. Inhale and raise your right arm above your head. | 3. As you exhale, bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on the ground. | 4. Look up towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths. Then switch sides and repeat the pose on the other side.

1. Lie down on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides. | 2. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest. | 3. Slowly twist your body to the left side, bringing your right knee across your body towards the ground on the left side. | 4. Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

1. Start in a downward facing dog position. | 2. Shift your weight onto your left hand and foot, and lift your right leg towards the ceiling. | 3. Slowly bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right hand as you open up your chest towards the ceiling. | 4. Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

1. Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. | 2. Place your forearms on the floor and interlace your fingers. | 3. Place the crown of your head on the floor and tuck your toes under. | 4. Walk your feet towards your head and lift your hips up. | 5. Straighten your legs and find your balance. Hold for several breaths and then release.

1. Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart. | 2. Interlace your fingers behind your back and inhale to expand your chest. | 3. Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

1. Start seated or standing with your arms at your sides. | 2. Bring your hands behind your back and interlace your fingers with your palms facing up. | 3. Inhale and draw your shoulder blades together, lifting your chest. | 4. Exhale and gently press your hands down towards the floor as you continue to lift your chest.

1. Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground. | 2. Walk your hands forward as you lower your chest towards the ground. | 3. Keep your hips over your knees and extend your arms out in front of you. | 4. Hold for a few breaths and then release.
1. Hold the bosu vertically. | 2. Flex your elbows curling the bosu toward your chin.
1. Hold bosu and hinge forward. | 2. Pull bosu towards chest, squeezing shoulder blades.

Exercise Name: Bosu Ball Single Leg Hip Thrust
Instructions: 1. Sit on Bosu, lean back, one foot on the floor. | 2. Drive hips upward, squeezing glutes, one leg extended. | 3. Lower hips back down and switch legs.
1. Lie face down on Bosu, arms extended. | 2. Lift arms, chest, and legs off the Bosu. | 3. Hold for a moment, then lower back down.
1. Place forearms on Bosu, elbows under shoulders. | 2. Extend legs, keeping body straight. | 3. Hold the plank position, engaging core.
1. Place hands on Bosu, shoulder-width apart. | 2. Extend legs, keeping body straight. | 3. Hold the plank position, engaging core.
1. Start in a plank position with Bosu under feet. | 2. Lift one leg back, squeezing glutes. | 3. Lower the leg back down and switch sides.
1. Lie on back, bosu elevated toward the ceiling. | 2. Sit up, engaging core muscles. | 3. Lower back down to complete one situp.
1. Stand in front of a low box. | 2. Bring one foot to the edge of the box and alternate as quickly as possible. | 3. Only lightly tap your feet to the box.

Exercise Name: Cardio Skater To Single Leg Burpee
